name: epicurus
text: Philippe's fear of Cod is so great.

name: catachresis
text: He's a Cod-fearing man

name: epicurus
text: The above comment needs some chubbies.

name: straw
text: A comment left by straw was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by joeyramoney, Thorfinn, Hipjiverobot, kenthegod, isunklower)

name: i_love_kate
text: I know, I know... Catachresis' is pretty good as well.

name: epicurus
text: Thanks a lot, now I look like an asshole.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Not even.

Right now his comment has 432 chubbies, you deserve at least 400 of those for setting him up. Making the "cod-fearing man" joke at that point was like shooting a rabbit nailed to a board with a shotgun.

But I'm gonna agree with dovey below and say that, while funny, catachresis' post is pretty overrated, chubby-wise.

name: unquotable
text: A comment left by unquotable was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by littlecat, Professorbun, MrEctomy, Epicurus)

name: gormster
text: Holy shit 150 chubbies... that's gotta be some kind of record.

name: dumase
text: Nope. See the recent garfield strip which i am too lazy to link.

name: vermy
text: You sir, deserve FAR more chubbies than 170. And far less lames than 1

name: gmm
text: 200 Chubbies well earned.

name: dovey
text: Holy shit, what? I mean, it's a decent comment, but why is everyone so apeshit over it?

name: tommycrashwreck
text: I think everyone likes it one chubby's worth. And that's a lot of chubbies.

name: gmm
text: People on the internet really, really like fish puns.

name: firesign
text: While I realize fully that your avatar is actually Calvin in quite a state, I have chubbied your comment because it is exactly what Hobbes would say upon observing this thread.

name: gmm
text: Thanks Spider

name: woodenteeth
text: Oh shit! This whole thread no longer makes any sense at all!

name: cpnglxynchos
text: it STILL doesn't make sense!

name: invidious
text: Not to mention that the symbol of Christ is... a fish.  Thus, it works on both a literal and symbolic level.  Grand slam.

name: the_hubs
text: A comment left by the_hubs was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by zcross00, aliiis, lordofring, Feste, MortisInvictus, Sleaw, fattypneumonia, mcjuicy, Epicurus, Fathington)

name: tekende
text: Good job repeating that joke, buddy!

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Nice catch, buddy!

name: deus
text: Perfect, just, perfect.

name: deus
text:
WHO THE HELL LAMED THIS?

ANGLES WITH EYEBAWLS MAN! ANGELS WITH EYE...BAWLS!

name: dybrar
text: It would be great if we could get this to 500 chubbies. It would be a thing.

name: kingofshell
text: Truly, it makes me happy to give this comment the 500th chubby.

name: dusty
text: I am honored to award this comment it's 501st chubby. May you carry these five hundred and one chubbies with honor and dignity, into a new millennium where there is no darkness, forever and ever, may god have mercy on your soul.

name: syrinx
text: We don't usually get such great Philippe characterization.  This one's a classic.

name: william
text: I like how God's number comes on a free toothbrush.  In heaven, dental hygiene is very important.

name: dougthehead
text: I personally enjoy how the Estes Comanche is "covered in more black paint," apparently to cover up the original, non-authentic movie prop black paint.

name: detournement
text: The Estes Comanche comes in orange. Also, I'm pretty sure most model rockets are wrapped in a printed label, not painted.

name: pogo
text: I'm glad I'm not the only one who knows what an Estes Commanche with a D engine is.  Gotta do some rockets once the weather improves.

name: belgand
text: The attention to detail is quite wonderful. I suspect Onstad has certainly had his share of fuses break apart at inopportune times.

name: iidebaser
text: I take it as a reference to the black-painted styrofoam discs.

name: tragicone
text: Cleanliness is next to godliness, they say

name: fattypneumonia
text: I can't believe we don't have one post here on the importance of dental hygiene from Lemming of the B.D.A.

name: dejavroom
text: Look at the drawing of the god. Look at the face of the god. god has a skullet for all that's sacred.

name: relaxing
text: God is drawn in the style of Gary Larsen (the trademarked Far Side unibrow of wiseness.)

name: stuart
text: YOU MISSPELLED LARSON

name: stuart
text: also wisdom

name: relaxing
text: WISENESS. YOU WANNA MAKE SOMETHIN' OF IT?

name: deusoma
text: Stay off the beach, guys, keep away from the beach!

name: drago25
text: I was just thinking that, chubby for your observational skills

name: joeyramoney
text: you have a peculiar grasp of the english grammar.

name: woodenteeth
text:
Australian Citizens.
Skullet = Mullet.
Why do these slang terms rhyme.
What is Gods greater purpose for this??

name: drskradley
text:
No way. A skullet and a mullet are totally two different things in Australian lingo. Gary Ablett, Snr had/has a skullet (Hulk Hogan style), Jason Gillespie has a full head of hair in a mullet.

See:
Gillespie (mullet)
[IMGS OFF]

Ablett, Snr (skullet)
[IMGS OFF]
(best example I could find.)

Huh. Not really a skullet. Just balding.

The Hulkster, however....
[IMGS OFF]

Also, because I must...

[IMGS OFF]

I'll stop.

name: woodenteeth
text: Education. That's pretty much what I'm here for... Nice.

name: fallow_fields
text: when you Consult with god-with-a-skullet it is a religious experience. thats why you capitalize the "C"

name: ibetso
text: But not the "G" in God?

name: rizzle
text: Onstad, did you have to look up Estes Comanche or are you just that freakin cool

name: thedudeabides85
text: God looks like fat Hulk Hogan.

name: aarongstock
text:
fat Hulk Hogan

Nowadays, the "fat" is redundant.

name: tragicone
text: Zinger!

name: jackparsons
text: Just came to me. He looks like Peter Boyle in his final years. Who was, strangely, a monk once.

name: boredom_man
text: Damn. Hearing that makes Joe far creepier and Taxi Driver far funnier.

name: retinarow
text: Hulk Hogan looks like fat Hulk Hogan

name: werthog42
text: Comanche? Bah. The Mean Machine, now that would've been a missile. 6 feet of hell .

name: ricnine
text: So THAT was the interface Ray couldn't navigate? The dude must have cod for brains.

name: twohundredninety
text: They're probably six feet long!

name: pa_ass_nts
text: In his defence, he was still probably a little stoned.

name: coolbreeze3
text: You gotta love how God is bald and has a unibrow.

name: neonaoneo
text: Panel 15 sweetest thing ever

name: falseprophet
text: I am so proud of Philippe. At age five he already knows tough vocabulary words like "concern" and "precisely" and manages to use them both in a sentence spoken by God (naturally).

name: cormanosanchez
text: Being up on the spout of a whale, that high in the air, f-king terrifies me.

name: professorhazard
text: I AM F-KING, LORD OF THE SIXTH LETTER

name: blarghamagarky
text: Not the first time Philippe Imagines Himself Into Death

name: mikestan
text: I am now getting all my tooth brushes enscribed with my emergency phone numbers.

name: phthoggos
text: 5'd for Gary Larson God

name: heccibiggs
text: I love how whenever Phillipe thinks he's died, he's always so okay with it.

name: stormagnet
text:
I was kind of like that as a little kid. One time, when I almost died at summer camp (true story!) my last thought before losing consciousness was, "Goddammit. Doesn't this just figure."

Not on par with Philippe's reactions, but it amuses me to this day that my reactions was mildly irritated resignation, rather than fear.

name: stormagnet
text: ...as opposed to my reaction to my own uncorrectable typos, which usually involves cursing, desk-pounding, and the occasional keyboard flipping.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Thursday Blogs

Pat: I, for one, am GLAD gas costs so much these days!

name: unsentletter
text: Airwolf GUI = Amiga?

name: mugi
text: I can't believe no one's mentioned the alt text.  That's what got me.

name: hamscout
text:
...bright lights, a wisened man in a white coat, a gas-induced comfortable feeling of peace...

Yeah, I can see how Phillipe would confuse Deity with Dentistry...

name: mattylite
text: For a little bit I thought panel 6 was a narrator.  Just because the bubbles aren't hooked to anything.  But on second reading I think it's Teodor, right?  Right?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: Classically Fived.

name: woodenteeth
text: Panel 10: I can actually imagine Phillipe as one of those prizes in the grappling hook game at an arcade.

name: spicyponyhead
text: That would be RAD.

text: I am currently Working on this.

name: woodenteeth
text: You have flash skills? This pleases me.

text: [IMGS OFF]

name: spicyponyhead
text:
O shit, that makes me want to cry.
HE IS FIVE.

name: rowan
text: God would really care a lot about brushing your teeth I mean we are created in his image and everyone likes having nice teeth

name: chetyre
text: When rating strips, I try to judge them in perspective to every other Achewood I've read--in other words, I only give out 5's every once in a while.  That being said, this strip deserves a 7 or so.

name: puguglypress
text: "That way I can Consult you!" The otter at least knows that he's supposed to capitalize SOMETHING in that sentence.

name: ezri
text: Going through the Achewood archives, I have noticed that a lot of people are saying that "<insert year here>" is the "golden age of Achewood". But really, it is 2006 that is the year of Achewood. Great Outdoor Fight, Airwolf and "STUPID CODS!" really are the greatest moments. All in the space of two months too!

name: stuntman
text: Cue airwolf theme song frame 8.
